description: Change of use of first and second floors from commercial storage to 9 self contained flats (6 x 1 bedroom, 1 x 2 bedroom and 2 x 3 bedroom); construction of a first floor level rear extension, second floor addition; provision of refuse storage and cycle parking and external alterations to eastern elevation.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 857- DG- 0000 Rev. D, 857- DG- 0100 Rev. C, 857- DG- 0200 Rev. D, 857- DG- 0S01 - Block plan indicating overlooking distances,  857- DG- XX01 Rev. B,  857- DG- XX02, 857-ES-XX01 Rev. B, 857-ES- XX02 Rev. B, 857- ES- XX03 Rev. D, 857-ES-XX04 Rev. B, 857- DG-XX05 Rev. D and 857- DG- XX06 Rev. C and email dated 8th May 2017 confirming agreed privacy screen to the edges of the balconies.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces as shown on the approved plans of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4  and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1(g), 1.2(f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy 92012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.

| Refuse storage shall be provided in accordance with the approved plan number 857 - DG - 00 00. Such provision shall be installed and available for use prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and thereafter shall be retained.

Reason: To ensure adequate bin storage is provided in accordance with Standard 3.5.1 of the London Supplementary Planning Guidance, policy 5.17 of the London Plan and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD.

| The development herby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air to all habitable spaces fronting onto Broadway and Green Man Lane. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The rating noise level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the proposed development as assessed under BS4142: 2014 will not exceed the existing background sound level as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan, policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| Bicycle storage shall be provided in accordance with the approved plan  no.857 - DG - 00 00. Such provision shall be installed and brought into use prior to the occupation of the development and retained permanently.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate bicycle parking provision and highway and pedestrian safety, all in accordance with policy 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and policies 6.8, 6.11, 6.13 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) Section 4 - Promoting Sustainable Transport. | The approved balconies to Units 1 and 6 shall be fitted with obscure glazing.

Reason: In the interest of the occupiers of neighbouring development and prospective occupiers of the residential development hereby approved, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:

o Construction traffic management proposals to avoid vehicular movements Monday- Friday between 8.25am - 9.25am and 2.45pm - 3.45pm (during school term time), including details of delivery routes and HGV movements and details of any temporary site access/parking;
o Details of construction hours;
o Noise mitigation and monitoring measures in accordance with BS 5228-1:2009 +A1:2014- Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise;
o Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
o Details of temporary lighting;

o Air Quality and Dust Management Plan (AQDMP) that includes an Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment shall be produced in accordance with current guidance The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition, SPG, GLA, July 2014;
o Site security during construction;

o A drainage strategy to operate setting out controls of contamination, including controls to surface water run-off, water pumping, storage of fuels and hazardous materials, spill response plans and pollution control measures; and
o Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
o Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
o Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
o Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the unit and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.
